intro: Scleria fenestrata, commonly known as the window grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a grassy texture, while its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine. Scleria fenestrata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
